content: sloped stripe scarf this tunisian crochet pattern uses only tunisian knit stitches and tunisian reverse stitches to create its sloped stripes the pattern as written will create a 6 75 x 60 scarf but can easily be adapted to make the finished size smaller or larger supplies needed 350-375 yds worsted weight yarn size j/6 00 mm tunisian crochet hook or size needed for gauge ◦ 15 sts x 12 row in tks = 4 abbreviations chain - chain sts - stitches yo - yarn over tks - tunisian knit stitch trs - tunisian reverse stitch es - end stitch this is the last stitch of each forward pass insert hook through both the front vertical bar and the vertical bar directly behind it yo and pull up a loop retp - return pass chain 1 *yo pull through 2 loops* repeat until only one stitch remains this last remaining stitch counts as the first stitch of the next row this pattern uses a multiple of 6+2 sts to make the scarf wider or narrower increase or decrease the stitch count by 6 sts foundation row chain 26 sts starting with the 2nd chain from the hook pull up a loop in each back bump you should have 26 sts on your hook retp row 1 *tks 3 trs 3* repeat until 1 stitch remains es retp row 2 *trs 1 tks 3 trs 2* repeat until 1 stitch remains es retp row 3 *trs 2 tks 3 trs 1* repeat until 1 stitch remains es retp row 4 *trs 3 tks 3* repeat until 1 stitch remains es retp row 5 *tks 1 trs 3 tks 2* repeat until 1 stitch remains es retp row 6 *tks 2 trs 3 tks 1* repeat until 1 stitch remains es retp repeat row 1-6 until scarf measures 60 or desired length bind off slip_stitch across working in pattern finishing weave in ends and block
